snippet: The action means Iran cannot electronically repatriate billions of dollars worth of earnings from the sale of oil and other exports.
abstract: Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication, or Swift, a global communication network vital to the banking industry, announces that it is expelling as many as 30 Iranian financial institutions in an effort to comply with European Union sanctions against Iran for its disputed nuclear energy program; actions will cripple Iran's ability to conduct international business and further isolate the country from the world economy.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and STEPHEN CASTLE
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Stephen Castle from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The action means Iran cannot electronically repatriate billions of dollars worth of earnings from the sale of oil and other exports.

headline.seo: Swift, a Banking Network, Agrees to Expel Iranian Banks
headline.main: Global Network Expels as Many as 30 of Iran’s Banks in Move to Isolate Its Economy
headline.print_headline: Global Network Expels as Many as 30 of Iran’s Banks in Move to Isolate Its Economy

keywords.value: SWIFT(Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication)
keywords.name: organizations
